src:
Đoković po peti put najbolji u pariskom Bersiju!
03 Nov 2019, 16:21 by Milos
Novak Đoković – Denis Šapovalov 2:0 (6:3, 6:4)
Po peti put u karijeri Novak Đoković je osvojio pariski Masters! Srpski teniser je u finalu bio bolji od kanadskog igrača, Denisa Šapovalova, kome je ovo bilo prvo Masters finale, a drugo u karijeri, pošto je nedavno osvojio prvi ATP turnir u Stokholmu, pobedivši u finalu našeg Filipa Krajinovića.
Đoković je do pehara stigao bez izgubljenog seta na turniru, pa je i Kanađanina pobedio posle dva seta 6:3, 6:4, za sat i 8 minuta igre. Ovo je 34. trofej iz Masters kategorije za našeg tenisera, pa mu sada Nadal beži za samo jedan. Osvojio je i 77. titulu ukupno.
Denis Šapovalov je očigledno bio impresioniran veličinom događaja na početku meča, pa je Đoković stigao lako do 3:0, oduzevši već prvi servis gem rivalu. Mladi Kanađanin, i inače, igra izuzetno agresivan tenis, dosta rizikuje kod servisa, što je činio i danas, ali je to proizvelo veliki broj neiznuđenih grešaka. U tom drugom gemu prvog seta viđene su i jedine brejk lopte u setu, prvu je Šapovalov spasio, ali je kod druge lopticu izbacio iza osnovne linije.
Đokovićevi servisi bili su fantastični, ne toliko snažni, ali je procenat prvog bio izvanredan, čak 83% u prvom setu. U takvoj igri Kanađanin nije uspevao da mu ugrozi servis, pa je tako kraju priveden i set, rezultatom 6:3, pošto je Srbinu bio dovoljan jedan brejk.
Mogao je Đoković da dođe do brejka već na startu drugog seta. U prvom gemu imao je brejk loptu, međutim tada se Kanađanin, rusko-izraelskog porekla, as servisom izvukao, a kasnije i dobio taj gem. Držao se Novakov rival do onog famoznog sedmog gema u setu. Tada mu je servis popustio, promašivao je prvi, a osvojene poene posle drugog, gotovo da nije imao. Tako je i bilo, grešio je Šapovalov, Đoković nije morao mnogo toga da radi na terenu i stigao je do dve vezane brejk prilike. Već kod prve Kanađini je lopticu zakucao u mrežu.
Imao je priliku Šapovalov da se već u narednom gemu vrati u set, a samim tim i u meč. Tri uzastopne Novakove greške, kod 30:0, donele su mu prvu brejk loptu, ali je servis vinerom srpski as i tu pretnju otklonio. Dobrim servisima Šapovalov je ostao u igri, smanjivši na 5:4. Ipak, šansu da oduzme servis Srbinu više nije imao, Đoković je brzo stigao do tri meč lopte, a odmah je iskoristio prvu i po peti put postao pobednik ovog turira, što je apsolutni rekord.
Đoković je prošle sezone izgubio u finalu Pariza protiv Karena Hačanova, ali je sada titulom osvojio novih 400 poena, pa će odluka o tome ko će završiti godinu na prvoj poziciji, Rafael Nadal i on, pasti na završnom Mastersu u Londonu.
Od sledeće nedelje Novak će biti na drugoj poziciji jer se brišu bodovi iz Londona od prošle godine. Novak ć eimati 640 bodova manje od Nadala.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Djokovic is the best in Paris Bersi for the fifth time!
03 Nov 2019, 15:21 by Milos
Novak Djokovic - Denis Shapovalov 2-0 (6-3, 6-4)
For the fifth time in his career, Novak Djokovic has won the Paris Masters! The Serbian tennis player was better than the Canadian player Denis Shapovalov in the finals, this being the first Masters final and second in his career, having recently won the first ATP tournament in Stockholm, beating our Filip Filipovic Krajinovic.
Djokovic reached the cup without a lost set in the tournament, and the Canadian won after two sets 6: 3, 6: 4 in an hour and 8 minutes of play. This is the 34th Masters category trophy for our tennis player, so now Nadal is running for just one. He also won the 77th overall title.
Denis Shapovalov was obviously impressed with the size of the event at the beginning of the match, so Djokovic easily reached 3-0, taking away the first service gem rival. The young Canadian, by the way, plays extremely aggressive tennis, risks a lot with the service, which he did today, but it produced a lot of unforced errors. In that second game of the first set the only break balls in the set were seen, the first was saved by Shapovalov, but in the second he dropped the ball behind the baseline.
Djokovic's services were fantastic, not so strong, but the percentage of the former was outstanding, as much as 83% in the first set. In such a game, the Canadian failed to threaten his serve, so the set was ended, with a score of 6: 3, as a break was enough for the Serb.
Djokovic could have reached the break early in the second set. In the first game he had a break ball, but then the Canadian, of Russian-Israeli descent, pulled out with a service and later got that game. Novak's rival kept to that famous seventh game in the set. Then he lost his service, missed the first one, and he scored almost two points after the second. That's right, Sapovalov was wrong, Djokovic didn't have to do much on the field and came up with two bound break opportunities. Already at the first Canadian he knocked the ball into the net.
He had the opportunity of Shapovalov to return to the set in the next game, and therefore in the match. Three consecutive Novak errors, at 30-0, brought him his first break, but the Serbian ace service eliminated the threat and the threat was eliminated. With good service, Shapovalov stayed in the game, reducing it to 5: 4. However, he no longer had the chance to take away Serbia's service, Djokovic quickly made it to the three ball game and immediately used the first and for the fifth time to become the winner of this tour, which is an absolute record.
Djokovic lost in the Paris final to Karen Hachanov last season but has now won another 400 points with the title, so the decision as to who will finish the year in first place, Rafael Nadal and he, will fall at the final Masters in London.
Starting next week, Novak will be in second place as he clears points from London last year. The novice will earn 640 points less than Nadal.
